sen.j: 元杲（げんごう、延喜14年（914年） - 長徳元年2月27日 (旧暦)（995年3月30日））は、平安時代中期の真言宗の僧。
sen.e: Gengo (27th February 914 - 30th March 995) was a Shingon Sect Buddhist monk who lived during the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 藤原京家の出身で、父は雅楽助藤原晨省。

sen.j: 勧学院（藤原氏の大学別曹または諸大寺院が建てた学校）に学んだ後、醍醐寺の元方に師事して出家、また一定（いちじょう）・明珍（みょうちん）らに学んだ。
sen.e: After studying at a kangakuin (Fujiwara clan daigaku-besso (academic facility for nobles) or schools established at temples), he entered the Buddhist priesthood under Ganpo of Daigo-ji Temple before going on to study under Ichijo and Myochin.

sen.j: 淳祐 (僧)・寛空に灌頂を受け、安和元年（968年）内供奉十禅師・東宮護持僧となった。
sen.e: He was ordained by Junyu and Kanku, and in the year 968 he became one of the naikubu-juzenshi (the ten selected excellent priests for a Buddhist service in the Imperial Court) and gojiso (personal monk) to the crown prince.

sen.e: He attained the rank of Gon-Risshi in the year 981, and that of Gon Daisozu (Junior prelate) in the year 983.

sen.j: 真言宗の小野・広沢両流に詳しく「具支灌頂儀式」など多くの書物を著し、また祈雨法を修して霊験があったという。
sen.e: Being well versed in the Ono and Hirosawa schools of the Shingon Sect, he authored numerous works including "Gushi Kanjo Gishiki" as well as having numerous rainmaking miracles attributed to him.
